isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - Meritor Medium Duty Front Drive Steer Axle - Assembly and Installation - Install Axle Shaft and Assemble Steering Knuckle

svcproc.title: Install Axle Shaft and Assemble Steering Knuckle

note.para: If the axle shaft was removed without removing the steering knuckle, refer to the Install Axle Shaft Through the Steering Knuckle procedure.

svcsubproc.title: Install Axle Shaft and Assemble Steering Knuckle

caution.para: To avoid damaging the axle housing oil seal, do not slide the axle shaft spline across the seal lip.

step1.para: Inspect the housing seal to be sure that it is correctly installed. Install the axle shaft and universal joint assembly into the housing. Carefully align the inner shaft splines with the splines of the differential side gear (Figure 37).
Place the knuckle in its correct position over the end of the housing. Align the knuckle bores with the housing socket bores.
Position the cap assembly through the upper bores of the knuckle and housing until the cap is against the knuckle.
Install two capscrews and loosely tighten to hold upper knuckle cap in place (Figure 38).
Install the dust sleeve and thrust bearing against the journal on the lower cap.
Position the lower cap assembly through the bottom bores of the knuckle and housing until the cap is against the knuckle (Figure 39).
Install the capscrews for the lower and upper knuckle caps and tighten to the correct torque. Refer to Fastener Torque Chart.
Traverse the knuckle back and forth to ensure that it travels freely.

Fasten a soft wire or cord to the tie rod arm. Attach a pound scale to the opposite end of the wire or cord. Hold the outer shaft of the universal joint away from the knuckle opening and pull on the pound scale to rotate the knuckle. Read the pounds pulled on the scale (Figure 40). (Read the pull necessary to rotate the knuckle, NOT the pull necessary to start the movement).
The pounds pulled shown on the scale must be between 10-30 lbs (4.5-13.5 kg). The correct rotating torque is 8-25 lbf-ft (20.8-33.9 Nm).
If the turning torque is not within specification:

item.para: Traverse knuckle back and forth several times. Check turning torque again.

step1.para: If end play is out of specification, the axle has been damaged. Replace components as required.
